definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: Pour in water, vinegar and light soya sauce.
In a bowl, combine the water, brown sugar, soy sauce, apple juice.
sentences.chinese: 在一碗中混合水，红糖，生抽，苹果汁。

sentences.english: Sprinkle with the chopped spring onions and drizzle in light soya sauce and sesame oil.
sentences.chinese: 洒入葱花，淋上生抽麻油即可食用。

sentences.english: Add squids , Chng Kee's Light Soya Sauce and water, stir-fry and bring to boil .
sentences.chinese: 加墨鱼及庄记生抽王，略翻炒后，加水慢煮至滚。

sentences.english: Mix chicken meat with some light soy sauce & cornflour .
sentences.chinese: 鸡肉用少许生抽及生粉拌匀。

sentences.english: Try using it with a light sauce that's low in calories for best results.
sentences.chinese: 试一下用低卡路里的生抽伴着吃，会有最佳的效果。

sentences.english: Then stir in rice wine, soya sauce, water, chicken powder and sugar. Bring to boil.
sentences.chinese: 入加饭酒，生抽，水，鸡精以及白糖烧开。

sentences.english: Season with salt, soya sauce and chicken powder.
sentences.chinese: 用生抽，盐和鸡精调味拌匀。

sentences.english: In a small bowl, mix together the chicken broth , soy sauce and brown sugar. Set aside.
sentences.chinese: 在小碗中将鸡汤，生抽和红糖混合调好，放置一边。

definition: chicken bouillon powder (PRC)/essence of chicken, concentrated chicken stock sold as a tonic (Tw)
same as 朝天椒[chao2 tian1 jiao1]
